title: Mexican-style pork wraps
time: Takes 15 min to make, 40 min to cook
description: Use up leftover pork belly in these speedy, and scrumptious, Mexican pork wraps made with shop-bought tomato salsa, avocado, lettuce and soured cream.
ingredients: 150g Waitrose slow cooked pork belly, or similar
2 tbsp Discovery Mexican fajita seasoning mix (widely available), or similar
4 tbsp Waitrose Tangy & Refreshing vine ripened tomato salsa, or similar

method.Step 1: Cook the pork belly for 40 minutes according to the packet instructions until hot throughout and starting to crisp. Allow to rest for 5 minutes, then shred using 2 forks and combine well with the spice mix in a medium bowl.

method.Step 2: Meanwhile, wrap the tortillas in foil and warm in a low oven for about 5 minutes. Unwrap the tortillas and fill them with the tomato salsa, mashed avocado, pulled pork, lettuce and soured cream. Roll up and cut in half to serve.
